sourceDesc.ab:
Vocabulary collected on: 2017-08-06 at:
12 Wohlebengasse
Austrian Academy of Sciences Vienna Austria

Content was recorded using Translation-based elicitation using a list of desired vocab terms and phrases English and/or Spanish; and Contextual elicitations in which the speaker gave examples of the elicited terms in various sentence contexts.

taxonomy.desc: Typology of linguistic speech events captured in recordings as per: Himmelmann (1998). aka Typology of "naturalness".

category.catDesc: Observed communicative event: the extent of external interference is limited to the knowledge of the speakers that the speech is being recorded or observed.

Staged communicative event: speech events realized for the purpose of recording (i.e. elicited speech). Events are not really being realized for the purpose of communication but for the benefit of the investigator.
Staged-Topical: Prompt to speak freely about topic
Staged-Stimuli: events based on stimuli to be described in speakers own words
Elicitation: speech act for the sole purpose of linguistic investigation. (A new type of speech event for most communities).
Contextualizing elicitation: where native speakers are asked to provide contexts for an item or construction as prompted by the investigator.
Translation-based elicitation: native speaker asked to translate item from second language
Judgement: where native speakers are asked to judge the acceptability of a given construction based on any aspect of language, e.g. grammar, etc.

spanGrp.span: low tone on final "i" in "titsi" for 1sg
Remember where you left the money

body.p:
tsituninu
:
to understand should glossform be "tsitunini" or "tsitu nini"? entender

spanGrp.span: Do you understand how I am speaking?
Do you understand what I am saying?

body.p:
sana ini
:
forget olividar

Sana ini yu
nixi nanu -
I forgot what your name is. Olividé cómo te llamas. I forgot olividé
your name te llamas

ntane'e :
to pick up
recoger

Ntane'e
sa'mu -
Pick up your clothes. Recoge tus ropas. pick up recoge your clothes tus ropas

kaki
:
to put down to put down (something) dejar colocar poner

Kaki sulu ntsa nuu sa'ma -
Put that baby on the clothes Ponga este bebé su las ropas. put down ponga ? ? on su clothes ropas

Tina luu sketa ti nuu yucha -
The puppy is running on the rivier.
El cachorro corre por el río. puppy cachorro is running está corriendo into por river río

ntasama :
to change
cambiar

Ntsama xu'un yo'o -
Change this money. Cambias este dinero. change cambia
money dinero this este

nisa :
how much? quanto?

Nisa ya'vi
vilu ka -
How much is that cat? ¿Cuanto cuesta este gato? how much cuanto costs cuesta cat gato

ntakuaan :
to buy comprar

Ntakuaan sa'ma yo'o -
Buy these clothes. Compra esta ropa. buy compra

cha'vi :
to pay pagar

Cha'vi tsa'a ve'e -
Pay for the house. Paga por la casa. pay paga pay for collocate: "tsa'a" (foot) paga por for por house casa

xiko :
to sell vender

Xiko stiki ka'nu -
Sell the big cow. Vende la vaca grande. sell vende cow vaca big grande

sava'a :
to cook cocinar to prepare preparar

Sava'a chuun nakatso --
Cook the chicken for us to eat Cocina el pollo, para que comamos. cook cocina chicken pollo for us to eat para que comamos

saan :
before antes
Time

Saan ntsio Yucha Ncho'o -
Before I lived in Puebla I used to live in Puebla Antes, yo viviá en Puebla. before antes I lived yo vivía Puebla Puebla

takaa
kaa :
to look like be the same as Used with "kaa"; maybe should be "takaa (U) kaa" parecerse a

Takaa xito
ku
kau
-
You look like your uncle. Pareces a tu tío. you look like parecese a your uncle yu tío

vitsi :
cold frío

Vitsi nchu'a yee ta kuun savi -
It's very cold when it rains. Hace muy frío quando llueve. it is very cold hace muy frío when quando it rains it's raining llueve está llueviendo

kuntsitsi :
to wear traer

Kuntsitsi sa'ma ka'nu yo'o -
Wear these big clothes. Lleva estas ropas grandes. wear lleva clothes ropas big grande these estas

ixi :
fur pelo lana pelaje ”

Ixi ntikachi ka va'i
sa'a na sa'ma
-
The sheep's fur is good to make clothes with. La lana de oveja es bueno para hacer ropas. wool lana is good es buena they make is this "na" for 'they' as in the inflection of the verb? hacen clothes ropas

sana ka'an :
goodbye Not really translated to "good bye" but that what you would say when you are saying goodbye, but it means, we will talk again adíos hasta luego

tienda :
store tienda

Nako'on tienda , ntakuaan
mi'ncha -
Let's go to the store to buy nopales. Vamos a la tienda para comprar nopales. let's go vamos store tienda to buy why is this in infinitive? (and not in 1pl)? comprar prickly pear nopal

sata tiutsa :
tree bark bark corteza
sata yutu
tree bark bark corteza

Nikai
sata
tiutsa -
The tree bark was burning. La corteza estaba quemando. was burning estaba quemando bark corteza

kua'a
:
sister hermana

In kua'a ka skua'i
nuu universdad -
A sister of mine studied at the university. Mi hermana estudió a la universidad. a una my sister This is inflected for 1sg right? mi hermana studied estudió at a university universdad

ntaxito tachi :
to breath respirar

Ntaxito tachi anu , -
Breath into your heart. Respira en la corazón. breathe respira your heart tu corazón

ntakoo
:
to wake up despertarse

spanGrp.span: Wake up, lets go to the plaza.

body.p:
Xito -
uncle tío

Xixi -
aunt This is how you would refer to them all (i.e. all older women) tía

Nisa kuia inkau -
How old are you? ¿Quantos años tienes? how old quantos año you have New sense of "inkaa" meaning 'to have'. But this also exists with "yee", and "iin" so it's not really too surprising. tienes

kini xeen :
ugly feo

Kini xeen kau . -
You're ugly. Eres feo. ugly feo you're eres

yakua :
dirty sucio

Yakua kau -
you're dirty estas sucio dirty sucio you're eres

Nchii kuu ño'o -
What is this? ¿Qué es este? what qué is es this este

¿ Nixi kunia
kachia
? -
What does (X) mean? ¿Qué significa (X)?

¿ Nixi kachu
? -
How do you say? Cómo se dice?
¿ Nixi kachi ni
? -
How do you say...? Cómo se dice...?
